intro: Eriocaulon kinlochii, commonly known as the Kinloch sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a small, perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
